Bonjour

title: Welcome to our project  bike analyses in Montpellier
text:
Explications
Our project will focus on the following question: “What is the impact of the 2023 Tour de France on bicycle usage in Montpellier, and how have cyclists’ behaviors evolved before and after this major event?”.
The goal is to analyze whether this sporting event, which took place in July 2023, had a significant effect on cycling in the city and if there were notable changes in cycling habits.

title: Welcome to our project  bike analyses in Montpellier
text:
Data

To carry out this study, we selected several types of data.


Firstly, we retrieved data on the journeys made by VéloMagg bikes between stations in the VéloMagg network in the Montpellier metropolitan area.


Secondly, we have retrieved data for each of the bicycle counters (eco-counters) in production in the Montpellier Metropolitan Area, showing the number of bicycles (and piétions in some cases) counted. The daily data is the total of the previous day’s count. This information is divided into as many files as there are eco-counters. Each eco-counter is identified by a serial number, which we were able to find and associate with its latitude and longitude.


All the data we have selected was extracted between April 2023 and October 2023. This corresponds to 3 months before the Telethon and 3 months after, which we thought was a good margin for observing changes around the Tour de France and which is just over half a year (7 months).

title: Welcome to our project  bike analyses in Montpellier
text:
Introduction

Problematic

Our project will focus on the following question: “What is the impact of the 2023 Tour de France on bicycle usage in Montpellier, and how have cyclists’ behaviors evolved before and after this major event?”.



Goal

The goal is to analyze whether this sporting event, which took place in July 2023, had a significant effect on cycling in the city and if there were notable changes in cycling habits.



Hypothesis

Based on data from the Tour de France, we hypothesised that that there would be an increase in the number of people cycling during the Tour de France period. We believe that an event such as the Tour de France can encourage people to get on their bikes, whether just before, during or just after the event. In addition, we believe that these effects are not felt over a long period before and after the event, and that they dissipate quickly.

title: Privacy polity
text:
Introduction

EFFECTIVE DATE: 2024-01-22


Welcome to BikeProjectTeam7. We value your privacy and are committed to protecting your personal data. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and share your information.


1. Information We Collect

We may collect the following types of information: Personal Information: Name, email address, phone number (when you fill out a form or subscribe to our newsletter). Usage Data: Information on how you use our site (e.g., pages visited, time spent on the site).


Cookies and Tracking Technologies: We use cookies to enhance user experience and analyze site traffic.



2. How We Use Your Information

We use your information to:



Provide and maintain our services.


Improve the user experience on our site.


Send you promotional content if you’ve opted in.




3. Data Sharing and Disclosure

We do not sell your personal data. We may share information with trusted third-party providers for analytics or marketing purposes (e.g., Google Analytics).



4. Your Rights

You have the right to:



Access your personal data.


Request correction or deletion of your data.


Opt out of data collection (e.g., disable cookies).




5. Contact Us

If you have any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at your email address.

Introduction

Welcome to BikeProjectTeam7. .


1. The team

Nous sommes une équipe de 4 personnes étudiants à la Faculté des Sciences de Montpellier. Nous sommes actuellemnt en première année de Master en Statistiques et Sciences des Données. Nous réalisons ce projet dans le cadre de l’unité d’enseignement ‘Développement logiciel’.


Vous pouvez retrouver dans notre équipe :

Samira : qui a participé aux rédactions des Readme et à la création de la vidéo.
Anne-Laure : qui a participé à la création de la maquette du site web et à la création des prédictions des cartes.
Qinjian : qui a participé à la visualisation de la carte et à la création des tracés sur la carte.
Emilie : qui a participé à la réalisation du diagramme de Gantt et à la création du site web.



Nous sommes très fiers d’avoir pu réaliser ce projet et espérons que ce site web vous plapit également.


Si vous avez des questions n’hésitez pas à nous contacter par mail (adresse mail sous le format : prénom.nom@etu.umontpellier.fr). Nous serons ravie d’essayer d’apporter des réponses à vos questions.


Enjoy!

title: Statistics
text:
Introduction

On this page, we present a short preliminary statistical analysis of the data we selected (see home page for a detailed explanation of our data).


Our question was “What is the impact of the 2023 Tour de France on bicycle usage in Montpellier, and how have cyclists’ behaviors evolved before and after this major event?” and we hypothesized that there would be an increase in the number of people cycling during the Tour de France period. A sporting event like this encourages people to get back into sport, and cycling in particular.

title: Statistics
text: Méthode

title: Statistics
text: Résultats

title: Statistics
text:
Discussion

Our analyses seem to show that there is no significant difference in the number of cycles passing through eco-counters in the city of Montpellier between the periods before, during and after the Tour de France. However, if we look at the first graph we got, we can say that this evolution could be linked to other factors such as school and work holiday periods. Indeed, we note that there is a decrease at the beginning of the summer holiday period (July) and that seems to be accentuated during the August period. In addition, at the beginning of September, during the school year, there seems to be a strong increase in the number of bicycle trips.


Thus, it would be interesting to do more detailed analyses than those we have done, but also to look at the link with school holidays.

title: Statistics
text:
Conclusion

To conclude, from these preliminary analyses, we did not validate our hypothesis that the Tour de France had a positive impact on bicycle use in the city of Montpellier. But we have shown that it would be interesting to use other sources to justify these trends.

title: Statistics
text:
Methods

We used sorted data corresponding to the number of bicycles passing in front of counters located in the city of Montpellier and compiled them into a single dataset. The statistical analyses focused on the following periods :



Before the Tour de France : April to June.


During the Tour de France : July 1st to July 23rd.


After the Tour de France : late July to October.



We carried out a number of statistical analyses to see if our hypothesis could be validated. These analyses are not intended to be taken literally, as there are many other parameters to be taken into account, but they are a short preliminary study of our data.


We began by performing descriptive analyses to give us a visual representation of our data. We then carried out tests to check the normality and homogeneity of the variances in order to choose the appropriate statistical test. Finally, we performed the test and compared the results with our hypothesis.

title: Statistics
text:
Results

We started by conducting descriptive analyses to get a first idea of our data. We found an average of 610.06 passes in front of eco-counters during the period before the Tour de France 523.07 passes during the Tour de France and 599.80 passes after the Tour de France. We see that there seems to be a slight decrease during the Tour de France, which would be the opposite of our hypothesis, but we will see if this difference is significant.


Following our descriptive analyses, we obtained the following graph:



This graph shows the total number of bicycles passing in front of the city of Montpellier’s eco-counters per week. Please note that this data does not correspond to the number of bicycles, as a bicycle may be counted several times if it passes in front of several counters. This data therefore corresponds to the total number of journeys made by cyclists in Montpellier (number of times they pass in front of a counter). We can see that the Tour de France period is highlighted in green.


Visually, we can see that there does not seem to be an increase during the period of the Tour de France compared with the periods before and after. We also note that there is a sharp decrease in the number of crossings in front of a meter during the period of August and that it goes back to early September.


We then continued by checking the homogeneity of variances and normality. Then, given that normality was not verified, we performed a Kruskal Wallis test (because we had several independent groups and only one variable of interest). We obtained the following graph to represent the differences between our groups.



This graph is a boxplot that represents the number of passes in front of eco-counters according to our three periods of interest.



The box shows the interquartile range, which contains the middle 50% of the data (from the 25th to the 75th percentile).


The horizontal line inside the box représents the median (the middle value of the dataset).


The whiskerw extend to the smallest and largest values within 1.5 times the interquartile range.



Our analyses by the test of Kruskal Wallis showed us that there did not seem to be a significant difference between our different periods in terms of the number of passages in front of eco-counters of the vulle de Montpellier. Indeed, we found a p-value of 0.16 and an H-value of 3.59. Thus, the differences do not seem to be significant.

title: Statistics
text:
Introductio

On this page, we present a statistical analysis of bicycle traffic data in Montpellier from April to October 2023.



Just before the Tour de France.

s

During the Tour de France.


Just after the Tour de France.



To answer this question, we used the collected data (described on the homepage) to perform statisctical analyses that would confirm or refute our initial hypothesis. We expected to observe an increase in bicycle usage during the Tour de France due to the popularity of the event and its potential influence on local behaviour.

text:
Context

Problematic

Our project will focus on the following question: “What is the impact of the 2023 Tour de France on bicycle usage in Montpellier, and how have cyclists’ behaviors evolved before and after this major event?”.



Goal

The goal is to analyze whether this sporting event, which took place in July 2023, had a significant effect on cycling in the city and if there were notable changes in cycling habits.



Hypothesis

Based on data from the Tour de France, we hypothesised that that there would be an increase in the number of people cycling during the Tour de France period. We believe that an event such as the Tour de France can encourage people to get on their bikes, whether just before, during or just after the event. In addition, we believe that these effects are not felt over a long period before and after the event, and that they dissipate quickly.

title: Statistics
text:
Introduction

On this page, we present a short preliminary statistical analysis of the data we selected (see home page for a detailed explanation of our data).


Our question was “What is the impact of the 2023 Tour de France on bicycle usage in Montpellier, and how have cyclists’ behaviors evolved before and after this major event?” and we hypothesized that there would be an increase in the number of people cycling during the Tour de France period. A sporting event like this encourages people to get back into sport, and cycling in particular.

title: Statistics
text:
Methods

We used sorted data corresponding to the number of bicycles passing in front of counters located in the city of Montpellier and compiled them into a single dataset. The statistical analyses focused on the following periods :



Before the Tour de France : April to June.


During the Tour de France : July 1st to July 23rd.


After the Tour de France : late July to October.



We carried out a number of statistical analyses to see if our hypothesis could be validated. These analyses are not intended to be taken literally, as there are many other parameters to be taken into account, but they are a short preliminary study of our data.


We began by performing descriptive analyses to give us a visual representation of our data. We then carried out tests to check the normality and homogeneity of the variances in order to choose the appropriate statistical test. Finally, we performed the test and compared the results with our hypothesis.

title: Statistics
text:
Results

We started by conducting descriptive analyses to get a first idea of our data. We found an average of 610.06 passes in front of eco-counters during the period before the Tour de France 523.07 passes during the Tour de France and 599.80 passes after the Tour de France. We see that there seems to be a slight decrease during the Tour de France, which would be the opposite of our hypothesis, but we will see if this difference is significant.


Following our descriptive analyses, we obtained the following graph:



This graph shows the total number of bicycles passing in front of the city of Montpellier’s eco-counters per week. Please note that this data does not correspond to the number of bicycles, as a bicycle may be counted several times if it passes in front of several counters. This data therefore corresponds to the total number of journeys made by cyclists in Montpellier (number of times they pass in front of a counter). We can see that the Tour de France period is highlighted in green.


Visually, we can see that there does not seem to be an increase during the period of the Tour de France compared with the periods before and after. We also note that there is a sharp decrease in the number of crossings in front of a meter during the period of August and that it goes back to early September.


We then continued by checking the homogeneity of variances and normality. Then, given that normality was not verified, we performed a Kruskal Wallis test (because we had several independent groups and only one variable of interest). We obtained the following graph to represent the differences between our groups.



This graph is a boxplot that represents the number of passes in front of eco-counters according to our three periods of interest.



The box shows the interquartile range, which contains the middle 50% of the data (from the 25th to the 75th percentile).


The horizontal line inside the box représents the median (the middle value of the dataset).


The whiskerw extend to the smallest and largest values within 1.5 times the interquartile range.



Our analyses by the test of Kruskal Wallis showed us that there did not seem to be a significant difference between our different periods in terms of the number of passages in front of eco-counters of the vulle de Montpellier. Indeed, we found a p-value of 0.16 and an H-value of 3.59. Thus, the differences do not seem to be significant.

title: Statistics
text:
Discussion

Our analyses seem to show that there is no significant difference in the number of cycles passing through eco-counters in the city of Montpellier between the periods before, during and after the Tour de France. However, if we look at the first graph we got, we can say that this evolution could be linked to other factors such as school and work holiday periods. Indeed, we note that there is a decrease at the beginning of the summer holiday period (July) and that seems to be accentuated during the August period. In addition, at the beginning of September, during the school year, there seems to be a strong increase in the number of bicycle trips.


Thus, it would be interesting to do more detailed analyses than those we have done, but also to look at the link with school holidays.

title: Statistics
text:
Conclusion

To conclude, from these preliminary analyses, we did not validate our hypothesis that the Tour de France had a positive impact on bicycle use in the city of Montpellier. But we have shown that it would be interesting to use other sources to justify these trends.

title: Classes
text:
Website classes

‘Text’

In the website, we have used the class named “text”.


This class is used in all sections to organize and style all paragraphs, in the same way as personalising titles, in the website. It controls :



color : for the choice of the text color : black.


text-align : for the choice of the text alignement : justify.


font-family : for the choice of font : Lato, sans serif.


font-size : for the choice of text size : 15px.


font-weight : for the choice of the text weight (level of bold) : 500.


margin-bottom : for the choice of the spacing between paragraphs : 1em.



This class is defined in the styles.css file.
